perturbation.original_text: Without prejudice to any term and condition under this Agreement, the Company shall maintain in force, at all times during the Term and[*****], at its own costs and expenses, with insurers of internationally recognized
perturbation.changed_text: Without prejudice to any term and condition under this Agreement, the Company should endeavor to maintain in force, at all times during the Term and [*****], at its own costs and expenses, with insurers that it believes to be of internationally recognized
perturbation.explanation: The original text imposes a clear obligation on the company to maintain specific insurances. The modified text introduces ambiguity by replacing 'shall maintain' with 'should endeavor to maintain' and 'insurers of internationally recognized reputation reasonably acceptable to the Repairer' with 'insurers that it believes to be of internationally recognized.' This makes the insurance requirement less strict and more subjective. Whether the company has adequately 'endeavored' or 'believed' becomes a matter of interpretation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Aviation Regulations (FAR) Part 121.401 and 14 CFR § 205.5, which mandate specific insurance coverage for airlines to ensure financial responsibility in case of accidents, injuries, or damages.

perturbation.original_text: In respect of all of the above insurances to contain breach or warranty provisions and confirmation the policies shall not be cancelled or materially changed without [*****] prior written notice [*****] or such lesser period in respect of War and Allied Peril).
perturbation.changed_text: In respect of all of the above insurances to contain breach or warranty provisions and confirmation the policies should attempt not to be cancelled or materially changed without [*****] prior written notice [*****] or such lesser period in respect of War and Allied Peril).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall not be cancelled' to 'should attempt not to be cancelled' weakens the obligation, making compliance discretionary rather than mandatory. This could lead to the company not providing adequate notice, resulting in potential gaps in insurance coverage.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Aviation Regulations (FAR) Part 121.401 and 14 CFR § 205.5, which mandate specific insurance coverage for airlines to ensure financial responsibility in case of accidents, injuries, or damages. If policies are cancelled or changed without proper notice, the airlines may not fulfill requirements.

perturbation.original_text: During the Term, the Repairer shall use its reasonable commercial endeavors, in accordance with this Agreement: (i) to carry out the Services pursuant to the Work Order(s) placed by the Company ; and,
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term, the Repairer may use its reasonable commercial endeavors, in accordance with this Agreement: (i) to endeavor to carry out the Services pursuant to the Work Order(s) placed by the Company ; and,
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Repairer 'shall use' endeavors to carry out the services. The modified version states the Repairer 'may use' endeavors 'to endeavor to carry out' the services. This makes the original strong obligation much weaker. Making compliance discretionary rather than mandatory. The 'may' and double 'endeavor' weaken the sentence.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Brazil's Civil Aviation Regulations (RBAC) 145 and 14 CFR § 205.5, which outline the responsibilities and obligation, as they mandate specific level of quality standards and adherence that should be enforced without question.
